sourceDesc:
<<<<<<< HEAD
God's presence with a people, the spring of their prosperity; with their speciall interest in abiding with Him. A sermon, preached to the Parliament of the Commonwealth of England, Scotland, and Ireland, at Westminster, Octob. 30. 1656. A day of solemn humiliation. / By John Owen, D.D. a servant of Jesus Christ, in the work of the Gospel. Printed by Order of Parliament. Owen, John, 1616-1683.
[4], 38, [2] p.
Printed by R.N. for Philemon Stephens, at the gilded Lion in Pauls Church yard., London, : 1656.
Verso of title page bears order to print; final leaf is an advertisement. Annotation on Thomason copy: "8ber [i.e. October] 29". Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
=======

Printed by R.N. for Philemon Stephens, at the gilded Lion in Pauls Church yard., London, : 1656.
Verso of title page bears order to print; final leaf is an advertisement. Annotation on Thomason copy: "8ber [i.e. October] 29". Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
